messages.title: Jobs and Homes - Voters' Priorities
messages.content: Tory threat to Warrington economy - The number one concern of Warrington voters is the economy. Tory plans to slash public spending immediately could wreck the recovery and put people's homes and jobs at risk.

messages.title: Brief Brief Brief
messages.content: Labour is the party of the NHS, and most people believe their families have got better care under Labour, with record spending and over a hundred new hospitals built since 1997. NHS is finally safe in Labour's hands. Labour is also committed to a National Care Service for the elderly, paid for with a mansion tax, and will maintain help for pensioners with the Winter Fuel Allowance, free TV licences, and free bus passes.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour will continue to support the economy this year, and halve the deficit within 4 years. Tories would recklessly slash public spending now, damaging public services and putting the fragile economic recovery at risk.
Labour is the party of the NHS with a record of improved care, over a hundred new hospitals since 1997, and the NHS finally safe in Labour's hands.
Labour has increased investment in education, allocated £80 million for new school buildings, including a total rebuild for Penketh High School. Tories would scrap this.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Labour's possible loss of the Penketh Library.

issues.economy: Labour committed to support the economy and halve the deficit within 4 years.
issues.education: Labour has increased investment in education, allocated £80 million for new school buildings.
issues.health: Labour is the party of the NHS, with over a hundred new hospitals since 1997.
issues.socialWelfare: Labour committed to a National Care Service for the elderly, maintained support for pensioners with the Winter Fuel Allowance, free TV licences, and free bus passes.

housing.content: Tory threat to Warrington economy could put people's homes and jobs at risk.

contactInformation.address: Nick Bent, Labour Party, Balfour Street, Thelwall New Road, Thelwall, WA4 2LY

endorsements.endorser: Mohammed Kaiser and Nick Bent at Penketh Library

quotes.text: Nick Bent commented: There is a clear choice for voters. Labour will continue to support the economy this year, and halve the deficit within 4 years. The Tories would recklessly slash public spending now, damaging public services and putting the fragile economic recovery at risk.

images.caption: Mohammed Kaiser and Nick Bent at Penketh Library
The NHS safe in Labour hands
